div.div: returns the depreciation of an asset using the standard double declining balance method.

div.span: the end of life value of the asset (can be 0)
the number of periods over which you are depreciating the asset.

the target period which you want to calculate the depreciation. Period must be the same units as life, e.g if life is 10 and period is 1 DDB will calculate the depreciation in the first year of the asset.
The factor at which to depreciate the asset. The default value is 2 (for double declining)

div.div: compute the straight line depreciation of an asset for one period.

div.span: the initial cost of the asset
the end of life value of the asset
the number of periods over which the asset is depreciated. If life is 10 SLN computes the yearly depreciation over 10 years.

div.div: PMT returns the amount of payment for a loan based on a constant interest rate and constant payments (each payment is equal amount).

div.span: the present value of future payments worth now, also known as the principal
the future value. The default value is 0
must be 0 or omitted (payment at the end of the period)

div.div: Compute the internal rate of return using an interative process. IRR works by trying to solve for an NPV (net present value) of 0.

div.span: a cell reference or cell range containing a set of cash flows
a starting value that is close to the final IRR. guess is only necessary if IRR returns #NUM! or if your sample size is small.

div.p: For more information see internal rate of return

div.div: calculate the net present value for an investment.

div.span: the value of discount over the length of one period
